# The `ShuffleVectorInst` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This instruction constructs a fixed permutation of two input vectors. <a href="#details">More...</a>

<CodeBlock>class llvm::ShuffleVectorInst</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

This instruction constructs a fixed permutation of two input vectors.

For each element of the result vector, the shuffle mask selects an element from one of the input vectors to copy to the result. Non-negative elements in the mask represent an index into the concatenated pair of input vectors. PoisonMaskElem (-1) specifies that the result element is poison.

For scalable vectors, all the elements of the mask must be 0 or -1. This requirement may be relaxed in the future.

Definition at line 1901 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instructions-h">Instructions.h</a>.

### isSelect() {#a747673ac3ea44aadc3907c6b9fd86237}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool llvm::ShuffleVectorInst::isSelect () const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Return true if this shuffle chooses elements from its source vectors without lane crossings and all operands have the same number of elements.

In other words, this shuffle is equivalent to a vector select with a constant condition operand. Example: shufflevector &lt;4 x n&gt; A, &lt;4 x n&gt; B, &lt;undef,1,6,3&gt; This returns false if the mask does not choose from both input vectors. In that case, the shuffle is better classified as an identity shuffle. TODO: Optionally allow length-changing shuffles.

### isBitRotateMask() {#a54f0b0ca5ff870c4dca191f5133dbb60}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool ShuffleVectorInst::isBitRotateMask (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; int &gt; Mask, unsigned EltSizeInBits, unsigned MinSubElts, unsigned MaxSubElts, unsigned &amp; NumSubElts, unsigned &amp; RotateAmt)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Checks if the shuffle is a bit rotation of the first operand across multiple subelements, e.g:

shuffle &lt;8 x i8&gt; a, &lt;8 x i8&gt; poison, &lt;8 x i32&gt; &lt;1, 0, 3, 2, 5, 4, 7, 6&gt;

could be expressed as

rotl &lt;4 x i16&gt; a, 8

If it can be expressed as a rotation, returns the number of subelements to group by in NumSubElts and the number of bits to rotate left in RotateAmt.

### isIdentityMask() {#a81aa4ff7f63f7988abea1abbe9eb0342}

  labels = {["static"]}>
Return true if this shuffle mask chooses elements from exactly one source vector without lane crossings.

A shuffle using this mask is not necessarily a no-op because it may change the number of elements from its input vectors or it may provide demanded bits knowledge via undef lanes. Example: &lt;undef,undef,2,3&gt;

### isInterleaveMask() {#af9582c096b5d287b663ec8ca4550aa72}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool ShuffleVectorInst::isInterleaveMask (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; int &gt; Mask, unsigned Factor, unsigned NumInputElts, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; unsigned &gt; &amp; StartIndexes)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Return true if the mask interleaves one or more input vectors together.

I.e. &lt;0, LaneLen, ... , LaneLen&#42;(Factor - 1), 1, LaneLen + 1, ...&gt; E.g. For a Factor of 2 (LaneLen=4): &lt;0, 4, 1, 5, 2, 6, 3, 7&gt; E.g. For a Factor of 3 (LaneLen=4): &lt;4, 0, 9, 5, 1, 10, 6, 2, 11, 7, 3, 12&gt; E.g. For a Factor of 4 (LaneLen=2): &lt;0, 2, 6, 4, 1, 3, 7, 5&gt;

NumInputElts is the total number of elements in the input vectors.

StartIndexes are the first indexes of each vector being interleaved, substituting any indexes that were undef E.g. &lt;4, -1, 2, 5, 1, 3&gt; (Factor=3): StartIndexes=&lt;4, 0, 2&gt;

Note that this does not check if the input vectors are consecutive: It will return true for masks such as &lt;0, 4, 6, 1, 5, 7&gt; (Factor=3, LaneLen=2)

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instructions-h/#l02341">2341</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instructions-h">Instructions.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/instructions-cpp/#l02295">2295</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/instructions-cpp">Instructions.cpp</a>.

### isOneUseSingleSourceMask() {#a6659bba6a4be5e7102bdb10e5fc3658c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool ShuffleVectorInst::isOneUseSingleSourceMask (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; int &gt; Mask, int VF)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Return true if this shuffle mask represents &quot;clustered&quot; mask of size VF, i.e.

each index between &#91;0..VF) is used exactly once in each submask of size VF. For example, the mask for <code>VF=4</code> is: 0, 1, 2, 3, 3, 2, 0, 1 - &quot;clustered&quot;, because each submask of size 4 (0,1,2,3 and 3,2,0,1) uses indices &#91;0..VF) exactly one time. 0, 1, 2, 3, 3, 3, 1, 0 - not &quot;clustered&quot;, because element 3 is used twice in the second submask (3,3,1,0) and index 2 is not used at all.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instructions-h/#l02300">2300</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instructions-h">Instructions.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/instructions-cpp/#l02253">2253</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/instructions-cpp">Instructions.cpp</a>.

### isSelectMask() {#a527e61685c56e6fab3cd424f74fa71ec}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool ShuffleVectorInst::isSelectMask (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; int &gt; Mask, int NumSrcElts)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Return true if this shuffle mask chooses elements from its source vectors without lane crossings.

A shuffle using this mask would be equivalent to a vector select with a constant condition operand. Example: &lt;4,1,6,undef&gt; This returns false if the mask does not choose from both input vectors. In that case, the shuffle is better classified as an identity shuffle. This assumes that vector operands are the same length as the mask (a length-changing shuffle can never be equivalent to a vector select).

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instructions-h/#l02074">2074</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instructions-h">Instructions.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/instructions-cpp/#l01925">1925</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/instructions-cpp">Instructions.cpp</a>.

### isSpliceMask() {#a2474ac30a61257b802cf6ba054e3ef45}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool ShuffleVectorInst::isSpliceMask (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; int &gt; Mask, int NumSrcElts, int &amp; Index)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Return true if this shuffle mask is a splice mask, concatenating the two inputs together and then extracts an original width vector starting from the splice index.

Example: shufflevector &lt;4 x n&gt; A, &lt;4 x n&gt; B, &lt;1,2,3,4&gt; This assumes that vector operands (of length <code>NumSrcElts</code>) are the same length as the mask.

### isTransposeMask() {#a9c89d6ee326837db1cf0876959acf9c8}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool ShuffleVectorInst::isTransposeMask (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; int &gt; Mask, int NumSrcElts)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Return true if this shuffle mask is a transpose mask.

Transpose vector masks transpose a 2xn matrix. They read corresponding even- or odd-numbered vector elements from two n-dimensional source vectors and write each result into consecutive elements of an n-dimensional destination vector. Two shuffles are necessary to complete the transpose, one for the even elements and another for the odd elements. This description closely follows how the TRN1 and TRN2 <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/aarch64">AArch64</a> instructions operate.

For example, a simple 2x2 matrix can be transposed with:

; Original matrix m0 = &lt; a, b &gt; m1 = &lt; c, d &gt;

; Transposed matrix t0 = &lt; a, c &gt; = shufflevector m0, m1, &lt; 0, 2 &gt; t1 = &lt; b, d &gt; = shufflevector m0, m1, &lt; 1, 3 &gt;

For matrices having greater than n columns, the resulting nx2 transposed matrix is stored in two result vectors such that one vector contains interleaved elements from all the even-numbered rows and the other vector contains interleaved elements from all the odd-numbered rows. For example, a 2x4 matrix can be transposed with:

; Original matrix m0 = &lt; a, b, c, d &gt; m1 = &lt; e, f, g, h &gt;

; Transposed matrix t0 = &lt; a, e, c, g &gt; = shufflevector m0, m1 &lt; 0, 4, 2, 6 &gt; t1 = &lt; b, f, d, h &gt; = shufflevector m0, m1 &lt; 1, 5, 3, 7 &gt;

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instructions-h/#l02171">2171</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instructions-h">Instructions.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/instructions-cpp/#l01940">1940</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/instructions-cpp">Instructions.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### isZeroEltSplatMask() {#a0b836340e75383742d06fd0ad2f23ff8}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool ShuffleVectorInst::isZeroEltSplatMask (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; int &gt; Mask, int NumSrcElts)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Return true if this shuffle mask chooses all elements with the same value as the first element of exactly one source vector.

Example: &lt;4,undef,undef,4&gt; This assumes that vector operands (of length <code>NumSrcElts</code>) are the same length as the mask.
